author: anundfuersich
body:
oh. Microvast is a US company with subs in China. China is their biggest market and it's where they have the most employees. But Apple, GM, etc. US companies have operations in China. Some, like Amphenol, might even have more employees in China than in the US. But I don't think Microvast would be de-listed.

more importantly, Trump is out within January. Even if THCB signs a deal by then,  and even if it somehow delisted companies like Apple (no way!) or otherwise affected Microvast, then they could just complete the merger/DeSPAC after Biden is in office once that is rolled back or challenged by courts.

$930M proforma revs based on ACTUALS. Not some fairy dust hocus pocus BS that we have been seeing with some next level pump and dumps.

Long Aph. 

P.S: I used to think Aphria was bad news, but now I am convinced they are making good moves.

author: QueafyGreens
body: Ow. Just got stopped out of APH. Been holding for a long time, but just bought a house, can't have the volitility right now. If I have cash later I'll look for a re-entry. It's been fun.

author: siempreeshoy
body:
My opinion is the brand awareness they have been pushing is for the product line brands itself: Solei, Riff, Broken Coast and not the name Aphria itself. I agree with your point, if you go to a recreational MJ dispensary in Canada all products are sorted by brands and most people wouldn't know which company Riff or San Rafael belong too. It seems they want to built household awareness plus alternative revenue right now and roll out THC/CBD type products later on as market conditions allow. 

You can look at slides 25-27 in the APH 2020 AGM Presentation for proof of concept of their product line brands on SW cans. Not sure if this will be allowed in Canada, hoping they can circumvent the cannabis advertising rules until they change to match alcohol advertising. I trust their marketing is continually seeing how far they can push the rules, like how online poker sites use a .net vs .com domain.  
[https://aphriainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Aphria-Inc.-November-2020-AGM-Presentation-FINAL.pdf](https://aphriainc.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/Aphria-Inc.-November-2020-AGM-Presentation-FINAL.pdf)

author: OldTracker1
body: Ya, smells a little swampy. At the very least stagnant. I did well with aph back aways and dumped all my small pos'n yesterday at $10.77. Not any more I don't think. Look at todays drop. So predictable. Seems shareholders have no idea what the hell is going on. Just out of the blue. It will be an interesting couple of weeks. Who knows how this will pan out. I am not really interested in a U.S. ticker for this unpredictable pot stock. I just feel like Irwin is hiding something by not keeping it in a Canadian exchange. Cheers mate.

author: Dancedancebear
body:
I bought $APH, at a little under 7. The main reasons being that it’s a leader in Canada, and the weed market in Europe has a lot of potential, especially after the pandemic slows down. 

To name a few alternate stocks I’m intending on picking up: V, BLDP, and MO. Consumer spending with VIsa will likely have a boom once the pandemic is over, and expecting more of the same for alternate energy and cigarettes.

author: skinniks
body:
> I always thought of them as a shit scam company

They've actually always been a legit company.  EU-GMP back in 2017.  Peter Thiel behind them.  Actual international revenues.  Deal with AB InBev.  Manitoba Harvest fits right into Irwinn's wheelhouse.  Between Sweetwater and Manitoba Harvest there will be lots of opportunities for proactive brand-building in the States.  

I know Tilray has a lot of debt but they also do have a nice chunk of cash which must look attractive to Irwinn.  I don't think it's the deal I would have made.  I would have preferred an Acreage (but not Acreage)  type deal but maybe that type of deal wasn't out there or maybe that is still to come.

Just being able to get rid of the (undeserved) stigma associated with the Aph ticker is likely a win.

body:
How will this work exactly? If I have Aphira shares on the TSX, will I end up with Tilray shares on NASDAQ after the merger goes through? Is that like an automatic thing, the shares get journaled over?

Also, your comment suggests 1 APH = 0.8 TLRY, the other guy said 0.8 APH = 1 TLRY, which is it? The latter makes more sense to me given that Aphira will have a greater ownership stake if I understand correctly.

author: gdren
body:
even if they do $50m this year, after doing 8m last year.  That's fantastic.  Next year should be even better.  These guys have a lot of new markets to participate in and so far seem to be dominating the ones where they have products available.  #1 in Vapes nationally competing against billion dollar giants like Aph, Canopy and Aurora.    


They're just starting to enter the flower market with a bunch of different craft grows, their new automated, fully funded greenhouse is coming online, extraction facility still ramping up, a dedicated research arm and wellness brand positioned for the cannabis 3.0 market.

2B is a little high but these guys are worth way more than 200M

author: Dasky34
body:
IBM doesn't care because their profits aren't made from fanboys building servers in their basement with dreams of hosting websites. They make the $$$ from Gov't / old business contracts that react slower than dirt to changing times. Sure it'll upset a few people but tech companies don't care about IBM CentOs cause they've pimped their own linux systems already.

Bottom line IBM is gonna split, some old money will make $$, both companies will be slightly fancier version of HPE / HPQ to regular boomer investors that fancy average returns.

author: dwdsquared2
body:
**Events in the US Today (ET):**

* DAY - Wear a mask & socially distance <3
* 8:55am - Redbook (MoM&YoY) \[1/3 Volatility\]
* 9:45am - Manufacturing PMI (Nov) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 10:00am - ISM Manufacturing PMI (Nov) \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * Fed Chair Powell & Steven Mnuchin Testimony continues \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * ISM Manufacturing Employment (Nov) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 12:00pm - FOMC Member Brainard Speaks \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 1:00pm - 52-Week Bill Auction \[1/3 Volatility\]
* 1:15pm - FOMC Member Daly Speaks \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 4:30pm - API Weekly Crude Oil Stock \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 7:00pm - Total Vehicle Sales \[1/3 Volatility\]
* Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell is expected to caution lawmakers that the U.S. economy remains in a damaged and uncertain state.
* Tesla’s shares popped 4% in premarket trading after S&P Dow Jones Indices said the electric-car maker will be added to the S&P 500 on Dec. 21 in a single step despite its large size. The index provider had considered adding the $500 billion stock in multiple phases.

**Events in the World Today (ET):**

* 2:00am - UK Nationwide HPI (MoM&YoY-Nov) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 3:15am - Spain Manufacturing PMI (Nov) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 3:45am - Italy Manufacturing PMI (Nov) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 3:50am - France Manufacturing PMI (Nov) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 3:55am - Germany Manufacturing PMI (Nov) \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * Germany Unemployment Change (Nov) \[3/3 Volatility\]
* 4:00am - Euro Zone Manufacturing PMI (Nov) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 4:30am - UK Manufacturing PMI (Nov) \[3/3 Volatility\]
* 5:00am - Euro Zone CPI (YoY-Nov) \[3/3 Volatility\]
   * OPEC Meeting \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 8:30am - Canada GPD (MoM-Sep) \[3/3 Volatility\]
* 9:30am - New Zealand GlobalDairyTrade Price Index \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 12:00pm - Euro Zone ECB President Lagarde Speaks \[3/3 Volatility\]
* 4:30pm - Australia AIG Manufacturing Index \[2/3 Volatility\]
   * Australia Building Consents (MoM) \[2/3 Volatility\]
* 7:30pm - Australia GDP (QoQ-Q3) \[3/3 Volatility\]
* Cyclical shares led the Stoxx Europe 600 Index higher as banks, miners and energy firms climbed. U.K. stocks were up almost 2% after Goldman Sachs Group Inc. strategists called them a buy ahead of a Brexit trade deal.
* Pfizer Inc. and partner BioNTech SE have sought regulatory clearance for their Covid-19 vaccine in the European Union and BioNTech said it could start shipping the first doses “within hours” after approval.
* Oil erased earlier losses as OPEC+ sought more time to reach a deal on production policy.

**Earnings Before Open:**

* Momo, Scotiabank, BMO, Golub Capital

**Earnings After Close:**

* Salesforce, At Home, Box, Hewlett Packard Enterprise, Veeva, NetApp, Trip.com

[Earnings This Week](https://i.imgur.com/ShSvr9G.png)

author: Ironleg01
body: That's interesting, I would have thought that people would go from HP to HPE considering HP is PC and printers manufacturer and HPE is all about cloud. Any other reasons? Culture? Dislike of HPE CEO or anything like that?

author: maybeex
body: I'm very skeptical around HPE. What do you find in them?

author: jpsgshow
body: I like HPE at these levels but they have way to many business divisions, I fear they might lose focus

author: cybercuzco
body: You joke but HPE leaps are hella cheap right now.  I bought some a few weeks ago and have done pretty well.

author: MoonRei_Razing
body: HPE is such a terrible company to work with fwiw.

author: EnginrA
body: Two boomer tech companies:  ORCL and HPE

author: therealsparticus
body:
HPE has to compete with AWS Microsoft Google Fastly Cloudflare Nutanix and Purestorage. 

HP competes with Apple MacBook and Microsoft surface oils but These isn’t really focused on HP’s commercial PC market share which is HP PC bread and butter. HP is suited to compete with Dell and Lenovo.

It’s all relative to competition.

author: diamondtype
body: HPE is a good long play right now. I don't really see much happening before your expiration though. Don't see it going down much though.

author: Adamshmadamladam
body:
I posted this as a reply to someone but think it should be put as a general message to everyone, why I am bullish on CFII:  


Great marketing, looks like an amazing product, has Google/Netflix/Hewlett Packard/some big boomer companies as clients. Projected 100% growth each year. 0 debt as of merger. Your window literally turns into the window at the beginning of Total Recall, where it dims itself and shuts off light when you want it to and can turn into a TV/tablet. Its such a sleeper its crazy imo.   


Once they start targeting people's homes, even maybe vehicles, it will change the world.
